quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Country and Babies
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, brain, babies. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who wrote and performed a song featuring the lyrics: I just want your extra time and your kiss?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Prince

questions.question: Where should one use perfume? Wherever one wants to be kissed. Thats a piece of advice given by what prominent fashion designer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coco Chanel

questions.question: What famous fashion designer popularized the little black dress?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coco Chanel

questions.question: New Zealand was the first country to give full voting rights to women.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: All babies are born with a soft spot on the top of their heads. What is this called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fontanelle

questions.question: Which part of the body contains the most gold?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: toe nails

questions.question: Does a jellyfish have a brain?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What common drink was first named the “Esteemed Brain Tonic and Intellectual Beverage”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coca Cola

questions.question: Is it true that the maximum score you can get on SAT is 2400?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What are the numbers on a dartboard that flank 17?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2 and 3

questions.question: What sport was invented by James Naismith in 1891?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: basketball

questions.question: What temperature, in degrees Celsius, is Absolute Zero?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: -273

questions.question: What is the capital of Finland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helsinki

questions.question: Which of these is the nickname of New York City?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Big Apple

questions.question: What term refers to the science (or art) of kissing?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philematology

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Hill and Ghost
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, ropus, locations. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This cave located in Tennessee is said to be haunted by the ghost of a local witch, Kate Batt. Kate tormented and haunted the family that lived near this cave for years. The haunting continued until 1820 when the owner died. Many believed he was poisoned by the ghost of Kate. What is the name of this cave?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bell Cave

questions.question: In this Texas town, it is believed that a hill is haunted by the spirits of small children who were killed there. On the way to school one morning a school bus filled with children stalled across railroad tracks. Tragically the bus was hit by an oncoming train and only a few children survived. Today it is reported that cars that stop on this hill are mysteriously pushed up the hill after which small hand prints can be seen along the back and sides of the vehicle. In which Texas town is this hill located?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: San Antonio

questions.question: In Americas west there are towns that once boomed during the gold rush but are now abandoned. These places known as ghost towns are said to be haunted by the spirits of the people that once inhabited them. One such town is St. Elmos in Denver Colorado. In what year did this town officially die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1952

questions.question: Lightning Mcqueen was the protagonist of what movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cars

questions.question: This monster, who is classified under the family, Homolycanth Ropus, really has a thing about silver bullets. By what other name do we know the character, Lawrence Talbort?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Wolfman

questions.question: 12 squared is 24.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Is New York City the capital of New York?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What is the capital and largest city of Austria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vienna

questions.question: The ghost of this mobster is said to haunt two locations. One of them is a hotel in Las Vegas, the other - a private residence in Beverly Hills.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bugsy Siegel

questions.question: On this day in 1929, a massacre of mob members outside a warehouse on Clark Street in Chicago occurred. As people walk the street at night they claim to hear the sounds of machine guns and screams.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Valentines Day

questions.question: Hes quite the chef but if he asks you to bring a nice Chianti to his little dinner party, better stay home. He is incredibly lethal and totally amoral. He is guilty of murder, seduction and cannibalism. Which monsters only weakness is one pretty FBI agent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hannibal Lecter

questions.question: This plantation located in Louisiana is said to be haunted by the vengeful ghost of a slave named Chloe, who supposedly murdered the wife and daughters of the owner.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Myrtles Plantation

questions.question: The number Pi is larger than the number 4.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Have the Yankees played in over 30 World Series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: The Wii is a game console released by Nintendo.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Year and Bushel
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, drivers, definition. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital city of Iceland?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Reykjavik

questions.question: I Love You a Bushel and a Peck was a popular song in the 1950s. How much is a bushel and a peck?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ten dry gallons

questions.question: Who is the second US president?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Adams

questions.question: The actresss father created The Today Show, The Wide World of Sports, Your Show of Shows(aka the Sid Caesar Show) and helped  create The Tonight Show.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sigourney  Weaver

questions.question: The first African-American professional baseball player played for Oakland in 1916.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which are the only  two states in the USA that do not allow drivers to pump their own gas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey and Oregon

questions.question: The first known use, in English, of the word orange in reference to a color was by this man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Henry Vlll

questions.question: Lethality: He will not stop, EVER, until you are dead. What assassin from the year 2029 AD, had you better believe when he says Ill be back.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Terminator

questions.question: What is the meaning of the word labeorphilist?

options.text: An animal that is attracted to sweet smells

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A collector of beer bottles

questions.question: Which of the following is the correct definition of the word rod?

options.text: A unit of measure equal to 16.5 feet
A unit of measure equal to 3 bushels
A unit of measure equal to 6 feet
A unit of measure equal to the distance from a persons nose to his/her outstretched arm

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A unit of measure equal to 16.5 feet

questions.question: She is a very rude monster.  She sings with her mouth full. What is the name of the human flesh eating plant that sings Feed me Seymour. Feed me all night long.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Audrey II

questions.question: What is Bandar Seri Begawan?

options.text: The capital city of an Asian nation
The largest city in the Kurdish section of Iraq
The name of the Prime Minister of a North African nation
The name of a terrorist organization in Afghanistan

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The capital city of an Asian nation

questions.question: In the same year that the first Grammy for Rap music was given, this song won for Best Song of the Year and Best Record of the Year and the singer who performed it won the Grammy for Best Performance.

options.text: Dont Worry, Be Happy by Bobby McFerrin

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dont Worry, Be Happy by Bobby McFerrin

questions.question: What is methyphobia?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A fear of alcohol

questions.question: Michael Jordan is often considered the best player the Chicago Bulls ever had but they did not start winning championships until they traded Charles Oakley for this other big man.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bill Cartwright

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Color and Cats
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, jackson, appearance. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Orange and this color are the colors of  the holiday Halloween.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black

questions.question: Which two cats are the main characters in the Lillian Jackson Braun series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Koko and Yumyum

questions.question: Name the cat hero described in Shirley Rousseau Murphys books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joe Grey

questions.question: Orange is considered a safety color.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who is the cat detective in the Carole Nelson Douglas series set in Las Vegas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midnight Louie

questions.question: In what year did the color burnt orange get its name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1915

questions.question: Which famous cat made a guest appearance in the films Shrek 2 and Shrek 3?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puss in Boots

questions.question: Is orange the national color of the Netherlands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which of these cats could appear and disappear at will?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cheshire Cat

questions.question: In which story do we meet Grizabella the Glamour Cat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cats

questions.question: Who is the crime-solving cat hero of the Rita Mae Brown books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mrs. Murphy

questions.question: Who was the most villainous cat in the film Cats and Dogs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mr. Tinkles

questions.question: Where can the Orange River be found ?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: South Africa

questions.question: Who is Mother Gooses cat in the self-titled newspaper comic strip?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Attila

questions.question: Where can you find a city named Orange?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Cat and Law
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, circuits, cartoon. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: There is always an easy answer to every human problem - neat, plausible and wrong. What sharp and witty American writer made this observation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.L. Mencken

questions.question: Which cat is the advertising mascot for the 9Lives cat food?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Morris

questions.question: In the sophisticated industry of integrated circuits, what does Moores Law say?

options.text: The rate of advance will continue to double approximately every 18 months.
Progress will accelerate sharply over the next ten years and then come to a juddering halt.
Progress will continue at a steady rate indefinitely.
The rate of technological progress is bound to slow down in the not too distant future.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The rate of advance will continue to double approximately every 18 months.

questions.question: Work expands to fill the time available for its completion. Under what name is this law known?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parkinsons Law

questions.question: This law says that if things can go wrong, they jolly well will!
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Murphys Law

questions.question: What was the name of the cat that belonged to Topper in Thorne Smiths fiction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Scallops

questions.question: This is a ground-breaking law of linguistics first formulated in 1822. It highlights in a most intriguing way how European languages may have evolved since ancient times.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grimms Law

questions.question: Youve been working on a job for quite a while and achieved a lot. But now fatigue has set in and you find that despite your best efforts, youre no longer getting the same high level of results. This effect is neatly expressed in which law?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The law of diminishing returns

questions.question: Political leaders all too often engage in misguided undertakings in the hope of recapturing popular support. Not infrequently this backfires and popularity ratings tumble. This is a simple example of which of the following laws?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The law of unintended consequences

questions.question: Which of the following characters made their debut in Old Possums Book of Practical Cats?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Name the first cartoon cat that was created for the screen.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Felix

questions.question: If youre a butterfingers and in your haste to get started on the daily chores you drop your breakfast toast, is it more likely to fall with butter side down?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: In which film did Pywackett appear?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bell, Book and Candle

questions.question: What was name of the evil cat in Disneys version of Cinderella?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lucifer

questions.question: In every hierarchy each employee tends to rise to the level of his or her incompetence. What name do we give to this phenomenon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Peter Principle

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Diamond and Diamonds
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, computers, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: When you give a diamond to someone, it represents this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Everlasting love

questions.question: According to a belief,  women should wear diamonds on this finger.

options.text: The thumb of the right hand
The index finger of the left hand
The middle finger of the left hand
The middle finger of the right hand

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The middle finger of the left hand

questions.question: This is the age of most non-synthetic diamonds.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Over three billion years

questions.question: At the 2003 MTV music awards these two stars wore diamond necklaces with their initials.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Britney Spears and Madonna

questions.question: There are two naturally round lakes in the world. One is near Zurich, Switzerland. The other is in this U.S. state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Florida

questions.question: In the US Army, this rank is usually in charge of a battalion.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lt. Colonel

questions.question: What was the name of the first computer game?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tennis For Two

questions.question: We all hate spam on our computers. What is the computer term for sending spam as an instant messenger message?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spim

questions.question: This is the famous quote from Rene Descartes that means I think, therefore I am.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cogito, ergo sum

questions.question: Gemologists use eleven grades to define clarity. This grade means there are no inclusions or surface blemishes under 10x magnification.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: FL (Flawless)

questions.question: It was the largest rough diamond ever found, weighing in at 3 106 carats.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cullinan

questions.question: This is the name of the elongated diamond cut with pointed ends.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Marquise

questions.question: A pure diamond is colorless, but extremely rare. This is the color shade that most diamonds have.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellow

questions.question: Diamond is the birthstone of people who were born in this month.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: April

questions.question: This is the original name of the famous Taylor - Burton diamond, sold for $1,050,000 at an auction.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Cartier diamond
